author: ServbotKing

text:
You can either rip it yourself, buy the official soundtrack (if one exists for the game you're interested in), or there are a ton of sites with mp3 downloads.

As for the legality, if a content owner wants the video taken down, they can go through YouTube to make this happen. However, most content owners usually attach a third party claim to the video so that they can earn ad revenue. The only real problem I can see is if someone put ads on the video, earning money on content that isn't theirs.
author: F4m1LyGuy10

text: Retro did a fantastic job with the remixes of this theme in Returns. Hell, the mine cart sections were easily the best part of Returns.
author: neoswordmaster

text:
Gabe, I know you must have been asked this before but I wouldn't know how to begin to look so I'll just ask again. Where do you get this music to upload? Also (out of curiosity) what is the legality of this channel? You can't possibly claim fair use on this...

On topic: I don't remember the last time I played a DK game. They're really fun and I don't know why I've hardly played them at all. The series is hardly Nintendo's most famous, but it deserves more than Mario for sure!
author: NeatNit

text: Every single song from all the Donkey Kong Country games, and I'll even include Returns, is amazing :)
author: ChronoDA

text: I love all of these DKC songs! The songs from the courses at the beginning of the game are the most nostalgic to me because I was too young to beat it and hear any of the other songs that were further in the game xD
author: Zephyrale

text: My favorite game in the series comes in at #29. The series just got represented in the big #1400 video so I don't have much more to say! This game has some of my favorite atmosphere ever and my favorite theme in the series (Aquatic Ambiance). I don't think I've ever heard the part starting at 1:09 in-game, I always die before it gets there!
author: SupraDarky
